alert.note: Alert for Bolivar; Humphreys; Leflore; Sunflower; Washington (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 24 at 3:41AM CST until January 24 at 10:30AM CST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Arkansas, including the following counties, Ashley and Chicot, northeast Louisiana, including the following parishes, Catahoula, Concordia, East Carroll, Franklin LA, Madison LA, Morehouse, Richland, Tensas and West Carroll, and Mississippi, including the following counties, Bolivar, Humphreys, Issaquena, Leflore, Sharkey, Sunflower and Washington. * WHEN...Through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Flash flooding will likely occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Extensive street flooding and flooding of creeks and rivers are possible. Localized more impactful flooding could occur where the heaviest rain falls, including the potential for road closures. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Showers and thunderstorms with the potential to produce heavy rainfall rates will move repeatedly across the watch area today through Thursday. Much of this rainfall will run off and result in flash flooding of low-lying and poor drainage areas. More impactful flooding could develop where the heaviest rain falls.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
